name: Port Lincoln Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great location if you are going out on the water. Furniture could do with some refurb but everything you need is there in the room. Car parking right outside is handy!
reviews.title: Great location!

reviews.text: Needing a family break after a hectic Christmas, The Port Lincoln Hotel provided the ideal getaway. We had always wanted to visit Port Lincoln (a 7 to 8 hr drive from Adelaide - if you don't use the ferry) but was looking for something which was on par with a good quality hotel/resort rather than a motel or self catering accommodation. The Port Lincoln Hotel certainly fitted the bill and exceeded our expectations.
reviews.title: Perfect Place To Relax

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked a Deluxe Ocean View Room which included the Breakfast package for 2 Adults and 1 Child (age 11). Our room (513) consisted of 2 Queen size beds a seating area, good sized balcony looking out over the pool and a good sized bathroom. Being the newest hotel in Port Lincoln, the room still a new type of feeling with good quality furnishings, plasma tv etc.
reviews.title: Fantasitc New Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for two nights during December 2010.
reviews.title: Great location and a great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: ThePort Lincoln Hotel is in a great location and we had a terrific room with an ocean view. The hotel is still quite new and we had a great stay in every respect. Parking is free and easily convenient, and it is an easy walk along the main street into the heart of Pt Lincoln
reviews.title: Great place to visit

reviews.text: The only thing that stopped me giving this hotel a 5 was that it lacked that 'special extra thing' that makes a good hotel a great hotel
reviews.title: A really nice hotel with lovely views

reviews.text: I'd certainly stay there again next time I am visiting Pt Lincoln
reviews.title: had a great time! no complaints

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: While you are in Pt Lincoln, be sure to take time out to sample the seafood platter for two available at Dellacoline Winery. It's divine. We can also recommend the 'swin with the tuna' tours offered locally
reviews.title: Romantic catchup

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had been working on the Eyre Peninsula, and decided to have a weekend away. We booked a spa room on the sixth floor.
reviews.title: Very Comfortable so we stayed an extra night

reviews.text: The room had a great view over Boston Bay.
reviews.title: Excellent two night stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bed was very comfortable. The spa was very much enjoyed.
reviews.title: We will be back!

reviews.text: Very nicely set out room. A huge flat screen TV was set up just past the end of the bed.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel, considering it's in the middle of nowhere.

reviews.text: We had dinner at Sarins restaurant in the hotel one night, we can recommend that highly. We had room service the next night, very good.
reviews.title: Great value

reviews.text: Stayed in Port Lincoln on many occasions in past, first time at this hotel. Staff provided basic service but nothing special. Decor in rooms and generally modern and new as you would expect, but nothing special. Bathroom is basic, but had a good deep bath, but shower height too low and mirror difficult to get close to for shaving or makeup. Finished meals were placed in the corridor outside neighbouring room when first checked in were not collected for the whole time I was there. Disgusting. Restaurant late closing. Food and wine good selection and prices. Seafood platter was a big serve but mussels were a bit dry, otherwise good value. Better accommodation elsewhere in Lincoln
reviews.title: So much promise very little delivery

reviews.text: Stayed in seaview room and because of nightclub patrons ouside on driveway and footpath till 3.30am, we could not sleep.
reviews.title: Sleep after 3.30am

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: People urinating outside and vomiting in hotel lift.
reviews.title: Best place to stay for Shark Diving

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.title: Great Hotel in central location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have no real complaints. The hotel is basic. Basic rooms, basic food, basic service and we used it for what it was. The bar, Sharky's, is pretty fun and appears to be a popular place for locals. We came to Port Lincoln for the Shark Dive and that really is all there is to do there. The hotel has a lot of weddings and when we came in early we could not check in because they were packed. Our flight got us in at 10am and we did not have a room until after 2pm. They were nice enough to hold our bags while we had to find something to do. We realize this is not their fault. The best thing is that they had a laundry room which was well needed for us since we had been traveling for a few weeks already. Overall its a decent place to stay in a decent city, but unless you have something to do in Port Lincoln I wouldn't recommend it.
reviews.title: Fantastic Views, great restaurant, good quality rooms

description: The Port Lincoln Hotel overlooks Boston Bay with 111 rooms comprising of luxury and deluxe spa suites, ocean view balcony or town view rooms. Opened officially in December 2007, the hotel has a modern and spacious design, comprising of large public bar, bistro area and Sarin's restaurant that features locally produced seafood and non-seafood options.Perfect for families, leisure guests or corporate travellers - the Port Lincoln Hotel offers modern function facilities and dining options to suit. We also have tailored itinerary suggestions so our visitors can explore the Eyre Peninsula and enjoy land or water based tourist actitives during their holiday.
